trans-unit.source: The following steps help you use Azure CLI easily with the most recent version and the proper subscription.
trans-unit.target: The following steps help you use Azure CLI easily with the most recent version and the proper subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you need to install Azure CLI and connect it to your account first, see the [Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)](xplat-cli.md).
trans-unit.target: If you need to install Azure CLI and connect it to your account first, see the [Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)](xplat-cli.md).

trans-unit.source: To use Azure CLI for imperative commands with service management mode, you should have a recent version if possible.
trans-unit.target: To use Azure CLI for imperative commands with service management mode, you should have a recent version if possible.

trans-unit.source: If you want to update your version of Azure CLI, see [Azure CLI](https://github.com/Azure/azure-xplat-cli).
trans-unit.target: If you want to update your version of Azure CLI, see [Azure CLI](https://github.com/Azure/azure-xplat-cli).

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Set the Azure account and subscription
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Set the Azure account and subscription

trans-unit.source: Once you have connected your Azure CLI with the account you want to use, you may have more than one subscription.
trans-unit.target: Once you have connected your Azure CLI with the account you want to use, you may have more than one subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you do, you should review the subscriptions available for your account by typing `azure account list`, and then select the subscription you want to use by typing `azure account set <subscription id or name> true` where _subscription id or name_ is either the subscription id or the subscription name that you would like to work with in the current session.
trans-unit.target: If you do, you should review the subscriptions available for your account by typing `azure account list`, and then select the subscription you want to use by typing `azure account set <subscription id or name> true` where _subscription id or name_ is either the subscription id or the subscription name that you would like to work with in the current session.

trans-unit.source: You should see something like the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see something like the following:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you don't already have an Azure account but you do have a subscription to MSDN subscription, you can get free Azure credits by activating your [MSDN subscriber benefits here](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/) -- or you can use the free account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you don't already have an Azure account but you do have a subscription to MSDN subscription, you can get free Azure credits by activating your [MSDN subscriber benefits here](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/) -- or you can use the free account.

trans-unit.source: Either will work for Azure access.
trans-unit.target: Either will work for Azure access.
